questions.question_text:
An architect is responsible for creating the design for vRealize Operations. The following requirements, constraints, and recommendations were gathered:
✑ Enable Continuous Availability
✑ Monitor two physical locations
✑ The sizing guide recommends deploying 5 analytics nodes
What are two design considerations for the analytics node deployment? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
C and D 
"If you have more than one data node, there must be an even number of data nodes including the primary node. For example, the cluster must have 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14 or 16 nodes based on the appropriate sizing requirements."
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Operations/8.10/com.vmware.vcom.vapp.doc/GUID-FB1E9F9D-BFA8-4257-8D0A-A709995F997B.html

comments.content: Yes I agree that was a tricky one
Then the correct answer is DE - agree with what frederikn said below.
I think its one of those I gotcha answers. You create environments to physical datacenters not environments to physical environments.

discussion.content: What is the difference between B & D (physical data center vs physical environment)?

comments.content: You cannot have two vROps Clusters in one vRSLCM Environment, therefore I would agree to your first guess: DE

questions.question_text:
An architect has been engaged to update an operations management solution design to include VMware vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager (vRSLCM) so that the support team can reduce the complexity of environment and content management activities. The customer has provided the following information with regards to the existing environment:
There are four environments for business applications:
✑ Development
✑ Staging
✑ Production
✑ DR
-The solution consists of two well-connected data centers (with low latency, high bandwidth links).
-All Production workloads and management tooling are deployed to Data Center 1 (DC1).
-All Staging, Development and DR workloads run in Data Center 2 (DC2).
-Each physical data center has one vCenter Server and a sufficient number of hosts for workload and management.
-There are two separate VMware vRealize Operations (vROps) clusters, one in each data center location.
-Currently all content is developed in the DC2 vROps cluster before being manually imported into the DC1 vROps cluster.
Which two design decisions should the architect include in the solution? (Choose two.)

choices.D: An environment will be created within vRSLCM for each physical data center to logically separate management components.
choices.C: A single vRSLCM appliance will be deployed into each physical datacenter.
choices.E: A single vRSLCM appliance will be deployed into DC1.
choices.A: An environment will be created within vRSLCM across both physical data centers to logically group management components.
choices.B: An environment will be created within vRSLCM for each physical environment to logically separate management components.

questions.question_text:
An architect is responsible for creating a new design to centralize the logging infrastructure for an existing vSphere environment. The key stakeholder in the project has provided the following list of requirements:
✑ The management solution must forward all logs to the existing centralized Security Incident and Event Management (SIEM) solution.
✑ The management solution must be a minimum of N + 1 resilient.
✑ The management solution must provide the ability to view at least 2 months of live data.
✑ The management solution must meet a monthly uptime SLA of 99.9%.
✑ The management solution must support the collection of logs from ten geographically separated data center locations.
✑ The management solution must support the collection of a minimum of 10,000 events per second.
Given the information from the stakeholder, which two statements would be considered functional requirements? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The management solution must meet a monthly uptime SLA of 99.9%.
choices.C: The management solution must provide the ability to view at least 2 months of live data.
choices.A: The management solution must be a minimum of N + 1 resilient.
choices.E: The management solution must support the collection of a minimum of 10,000 events per second.
choices.D: The management solution must forward all logs to the existing centralized Security Incident and Event Management (SIEM) solution.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Functional_requirement - "Functional requirements may involve calculations, technical details, data manipulation and processing, and other specific functionality that define what a system is supposed to accomplish."

So I would go with DE, since I would say E falls into the category of data processing.

comments.content: I did more reading and I think E is actually a performance standard, not a functional requirement. CD seems to be a better fit. See https://elatov.github.io/2012/08/vcap5-dcd-objective-2-1-map-business-requirements-to-the-logical-design/ and https://www.virten.net/2012/06/vdcd510-objective-2-3-build-availability-requirements-into-the-logical-design/
why not C? because of historical data

discussion.content: CD because performance is nonfunctional requirements.
